summary:
## The Pacific Ring of Fire

The Ring of Fire is a huge belt of volcanoes and earthquakes around the Pacific Ocean. It's about 25,000 miles long and holds over two-thirds of the world's active volcanoes. About 90% of all earthquakes happen here.

This region is formed by tectonic plates crashing into each other, creating deep trenches and volcanic mountains. Some of the world's largest eruptions have happened in the Ring of Fire.
title: Ring of Fire
